metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the oval:CheckEnumeration simple type is properly supported for the relationship between objects and states
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the oval:CheckEnumeration simple type for the relationship between objects and states.

criterion.comment: Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'all' is supported where none of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'all' is supported where all of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'at least one' is supported where none of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'at least one' is supported where one of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'at least one' is supported where all of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'none exist' is supported where no matching objects are found.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'none exist' is supported where matching objects are found.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'none satisfy' is supported where none of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'none satisfy' is supported where all of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'only one' is supported where none of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'only one' is supported where one of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'only one' is supported where all of the individual results are true.

variable_test.comment: Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'all' is supported where none of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'all' is supported where all of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'at least one' is supported where none of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'at least one' is supported where one of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'at least one' is supported where all of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'none exist' is supported where no matching objects are found.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'none exist' is supported where matching objects are found.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'none satisfy' is supported where none of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'none satisfy' is supported where all of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'only one' is supported where none of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'only one' is supported where one of the individual results are true.
Test that the CheckEnumeration value 'only one' is supported where all of the individual results are true.

variable_object.comment: This variable_object references the integer value '0'.
This variable_object references the integer values '1', '2', and '3'.
This variable_object represents a object that does not exist on the system.
This variable_object represents multiple objects that exist on a system.

variable_state.comment: This variable_object represents a integer value equal to '-1'.
This variable_object represents a integer value that is greater than the integer value '-1'.
This variable_object represents a integer value that is greater than the integer value '-1'.

constant_variable.comment: This constant_variable represents the integer value '0'.
This constant_variable represents the integer values '1', '2', and '3'.
